data.title: Horicon, WI
data.meta_description: In 2022, Horicon, WI had a population of 3.79k people with a median age of 38.8 and a median household income of $48,266. Between 2021 and 2022 the population of Horicon, WI grew from 3,769 to 3,793, a 0.637% increase and its median household income declined from $48,616 to $48,266, a âˆ’0.72% decrease.
data.text:
As of 2022, 97.9% of Horicon, WI residents were US citizens, which is higher than the national average of 93.5%. In 2021, the percentage of US citizens in Horicon, WI was 97.7%, meaning that the rate of citizenship has been increasing.

In 2022, there were 46.9 times more White (Non-Hispanic) residents (3.66k people) in Horicon, WI than any other race or ethnicity. There were 78 Black or African American (Non-Hispanic) and 27 White (Hispanic) residents, the second and third most common ethnic groups.

As of 2022, 1.05% of Horicon, WI residents (40 people) were born outside of the United States, which is lower than the national average of 13.6%. In 2021, the percentage of foreign-born citizens in Horicon, WI was 2.65%, meaning that the rate has been decreasing.

The most common job groups, by number of people living in Horicon, WI, are Production Occupations (449 people), Management Occupations (220 people), and Office & Administrative Support Occupations (178 people). This chart illustrates the share breakdown of the primary jobs held by residents of Horicon, WI.

The most common employment sectors for those who live in Horicon, WI, are Manufacturing (719 people), Health Care & Social Assistance (244 people), and Educational Services (209 people). This chart shows the share breakdown of the primary industries for residents of Horicon, WI, though some of these residents may live in Horicon, WI and work somewhere else. Census data is tagged to a residential address, not a work address.

Members of the House of Representives are elected to 2-year terms, and the following chart shows the how the members for Alabama, Alaska, Arizona, Arkansas, California, Colorado, Connecticut, Delaware, Florida, Georgia, Hawaii, Idaho, Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Kansas, Kentucky, Louisiana, Maine, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, Mississippi, Missouri, Montana, Nebraska, Nevada, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New Mexico, New York, North Carolina, North Dakota, Ohio, Oklahoma, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, South Carolina, South Dakota, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Vermont, Virginia, Washington, West Virginia, Wisconsin, and Wyoming have changed over time starting in 2008.

In 2022, 0.697% of men over 25 years of age had not completed any academic degree (no schooling), while 0.597% of women were in the same situation.

This visualization illustrates the percentage distribution of the population according to the highest educational level reached. You can filter the data by race by using the selector above.

The following chart display owner-occupied housing units distributed between a series of property tax buckets compared to the national averages for each bucket. In Horicon, WI the largest share of households pay taxes in the $3k+ range.

In 2022, 66.9% of the housing units in Horicon, WI were occupied by their owner. This percentage grew from the previous year's rate of 63.9%.

The following chart displays the households in Horicon, WI distributed between a series of income buckets compared to the national averages for each bucket. The largest share of households have an income in the $60k - $75k range.

In N/A, the income inequality in N/A was N/A according to the GINI calculation of the wage distribution. Income inequality had a N/A N/A from N/A to N/A, which means that wage distribution grew somewhat N/A even. The GINI for N/A was N/A than the national average of 0.478. In other words, wages are distributed N/A evenly in N/A in comparison to the national average.

In 2022, 73% of workers in Horicon, WI drove alone to work, followed by those who carpooled to work (13.2%) and those who worked at home (12.1%).

The following chart shows the number of households using each mode of transportation over time, using a logarithmic scale on the y-axis to help better show variations in the smaller means of commuting.

Using averages, employees in Horicon, WI have a shorter commute time (21.7 minutes) than the normal US worker (26.7 minutes). Additionally, 2.76% of the workforce in Horicon, WI have "super commutes" in excess of 90 minutes.

The following chart displays the households in Horicon, WI distributed between a series of car ownership buckets compared to the national averages for each bucket. The largest share of households in Horicon, WI have 2 cars.

13.6% of the population for whom poverty status is determined in Horicon, WI (516 out of 3.78k people) live below the poverty line, a number that is higher than the national average of 12.5%. The largest demographic living in poverty are Males 25 - 34, followed by Males < 5 and then Females 18 - 24.

The most common racial or ethnic group living below the poverty line in Horicon, WI is White, followed by Hispanic and Two Or More.

The Census Bureau uses a set of money income thresholds that vary by family size and composition to determine who classifies as impoverished. If a family's total income is less than the family's threshold than that family and every individual in it is considered to be living in poverty.

In 2017, California had the highest estimated number of chronically homeless individuals in the nation, at 35,798. New York has the second highest (5,087), followed by Florida (4,915).

In 2022, insured persons according to age ranges were distributed in 24.6% under 18 years, 22.7% between 18 and 34 years, 34.2% between 35 and 64 years, and 18.5% over 64 years.

Between 2021 and 2022, the percent of uninsured citizens in Horicon, WI declined by 46.6% from 5.6% to 2.99%.
